intro: Orthaea panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian orthaea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Orthaea panamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its tropical habitat.
